sections.heading: Installation
sections.content: pip install cloudstore-sdk

sections.heading: Quick Start
sections.content:
from cloudstore.auth import api_key_auth
from cloudstore.api import CloudStoreClient

# Authenticate
token = api_key_auth("cs_your_api_key_here")

# Create a client
client = CloudStoreClient(
    base_url="https://api.cloudstore.io",
    api_key="cs_your_api_key_here",
    timeout=30
)

# Make a request
response = client.get("/v1/documents")
print(response.data)

sections.heading: Authentication
sections.content:
CloudStore supports two authentication methods:

  1. API Key Authentication — Recommended for server-to-server communication
  2. Basic Authentication — Username and password for interactive sessions

See the Authentication Guide for details.

sections.heading: Core Modules
sections.content:
ModuleDescription
authAuthentication and token management
databaseDirect database operations
apiHTTP API client
utilsUtility functions

sections.heading: Requirements
sections.content:
• Python 3.9+
  • An active CloudStore account
  • API key with prefix cs_

sections.heading: API Key Authentication
sections.content:
The recommended method for production use. API keys start with cs_ and are at least 20 characters long.

from cloudstore.auth import api_key_auth

token = api_key_auth("cs_your_api_key_here")
print(token.access_token)   # "tok_xxx"
print(token.expires_in)     # 7200 (2 hours)
print(token.token_type)     # "bearer"

API Key Validation

Use validate_api_key() to check key format before authenticating:

from cloudstore.utils import validate_api_key

validate_api_key("cs_abc123")           # False (too short)
validate_api_key("cs_abcdefghij12345678")  # True
validate_api_key("sk_wrong_prefix")     # False

Requirements:

  • Must start with cs_
  • Must be at least 20 characters
  • Only alphanumeric characters and underscores

sections.heading: Basic Authentication
sections.content:
For interactive sessions using username and password:

from cloudstore.auth import basic_auth

token = basic_auth("user@example.com", "password123")
print(token.expires_in)  # 3600 (1 hour)

Note: Basic auth tokens expire after 1 hour, while API key tokens last 2 hours.

sections.heading: Token Refresh
sections.content:
Refresh expired tokens without re-authenticating:

from cloudstore.auth import refresh_token

new_token = refresh_token(expired_token)

sections.heading: AuthToken Object
sections.content:
All authentication methods return an AuthToken:

FieldTypeDescription
access_tokenstrThe bearer token
expires_inintSeconds until expiration
token_typestrAlways "bearer"

sections.heading: Error Handling
sections.content:
from cloudstore.auth import basic_auth, AuthenticationError

try:
    token = basic_auth("user", "wrong_password")
except AuthenticationError:
    print("Invalid credentials")

sections.heading: Initialization
sections.content:
from cloudstore.api import CloudStoreClient

client = CloudStoreClient(
    base_url="https://api.cloudstore.io",
    api_key="cs_your_key",
    timeout=30  # seconds
)
ParameterTypeDefaultDescription
base_urlstrrequiredAPI base URL
api_keystrrequiredYour CloudStore API key
timeoutint30Request timeout in seconds

sections.heading: Methods
sections.content:
GET

response = client.get("/v1/documents", params={"limit": 10})

POST

response = client.post("/v1/documents", data={"title": "My Doc", "content": "Hello"})

PUT

response = client.put("/v1/documents/doc_123", data={"title": "Updated"})

DELETE

response = client.delete_resource("/v1/documents/doc_123")

Upload File

response = client.upload_file(
    path="/v1/files",
    file_path="/path/to/file.pdf",
    content_type="application/pdf"
)

sections.heading: APIResponse Object
sections.content:
All methods return an APIResponse:

FieldTypeDescription
status_codeintHTTP status code
dataAnyResponse body
headersdictResponse headers

sections.heading: Available Endpoints
sections.content:
EndpointPath
Documents/v1/documents
Collections/v1/collections
Users/v1/users
Files/v1/files

sections.heading: Connecting
sections.content:
from cloudstore.database import connect

conn = connect(host="db.cloudstore.io", port=5432, database="myapp")
ParameterTypeDefaultDescription
hoststrrequiredDatabase hostname
portint5432Database port
databasestr"default"Database name

sections.heading: Insert
sections.content:
doc = conn.insert("users", {"name": "Alice", "email": "alice@example.com"})
print(doc.id)          # "doc_xxx"
print(doc.collection)  # "users"

sections.heading: Query
sections.content:
result = conn.query("users", filter={"name": "Alice"}, limit=10)
print(result.total_count)
for doc in result.documents:
    print(doc.data)
ParameterTypeDefaultDescription
collectionstrrequiredCollection to query
filterdictrequiredFilter criteria
limitint100Max documents to return

sections.heading: Update
sections.content: updated = conn.update("users", "doc_123", {"email": "newemail@example.com"})

sections.heading: Delete
sections.content: success = conn.delete("users", "doc_123")  # Returns True

sections.heading: Close Connection
sections.content:
Always close connections when done:

conn.close()
